header.title: THE PLACE OF LOVE
authors: Rabbi, Kabbalist Michael Portnaar, Ph. D.

central_thesis: True love is not an earthly, self-interested affection, but a divine experience cultivated through conscious effort and self-correction, aligning with the universal law of absolute selflessness, and progressively revealed through a five-stage process that transcends individual perception to embrace all creation within the Creator.

structure_content.summary: This section defines 'the hidden word' as the divine instruction for human fulfillment, encased in coverings of creative forces. It posits that this 'word' is eternal and necessitates human desire, effort, and the cultivation of 'absolute selflessness' to be revealed, ultimately translating into unconditional love for others on Earth.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of Earthly and True Love
structure_content.summary: The author asserts that 'true love' is absent on Earth, replaced by self-interest ('maximize self-advantage with minimal effort'). True love begins with acknowledging one's distance from the Creator, experiencing divine 'High Light' as a consequence of aligning with universal laws, not as a personal or relational acquisition. Self-love is recontextualized as experiencing divine love 'in' oneself by conforming to these cosmic principles.

Emphasizing the principle 'nothing comes from above if not aroused from below,' this part details how human prayer and desire for love initiate the reception of divine light (the 'hidden word'). This process leads to experiencing love 'in the Creator' and subsequently building 'love in yourself,' a foundational step before one can perceive or actualize love towards others, moving beyond inherent self-interest.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Three Lines of Correction and Universal Perception
structure_content.summary: The text introduces the 'three lines' method of spiritual correction, which is presented as a universal esoteric teaching underlying Judaism (Zohar, Torah), Christianity (Trinity), and Islam (five daily prayers). It argues that the 'middle-line' (love in oneself) enables a shift to the 'right-line' (mercy), allowing one to see love 'in the other' by recognizing the Creator's attributes in all beings, regardless of their faith or perceived 'godlessness,' countering the self-serving nature of 'cherishing love for the other'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Formula of Love: Five Movements
structure_content.summary: A practical, stepwise system of 'five movements' is outlined, describing the journey to 'perfect love.' This process begins with human initiative (prayer to the Creator), followed by receiving divine resonance (love from the Creator), cultivating love within oneself, then recognizing love in others, and finally returning an all-embracing love to the Creator, unifying all creation within Him. This culminates in unconditional love, unattached to specific objects.

The author concludes by stressing the indispensability of mutual spiritual support and the inadequacy of mere 'tolerance' for achieving 'true fulfillment and perfection.' It posits that actively 'seeing love in each other' and drawing it upon the Creator is the only path to avoid suffering. A prophecy from the Zohar states that from 1995 onward, humanity will increasingly be able to perceive and embody this universal love.

key_concepts.definition: The totality of coverings encasing the creative forces of the operational system of the universe. It carries the divine instruction for humanity's ultimate fulfillment and perfection. It is 'hidden' because its eternal, unchanging nature is not subject to material changes, and it requires conscious human desire and effort to be revealed.

A divine experience, fundamentally distinct from earthly self-interested affections. It is received from the Creator as a result of human conformity with the eternal laws of the universe, particularly 'absolute selflessness.' It is initially experienced 'in oneself,' then recognized 'in the other,' and ultimately realized as an all-embracing connection to the Creator and all creation.

The principal law of the universe, which man must align with. Cultivating this trait, both inwardly and outwardly, gradually dissolves the 'hidden' aspect of the divine word, revealing it and enabling the reception of true love. It contrasts with the earthly law of 'maximize self-advantage with minimal effort'.

A systematic spiritual methodology for human correction and conformity with universal attributes. It is presented as a universal esoteric principle underlying diverse religious traditions (e.g., Kabbalistic Zohar, Christian Trinity, Islamic prayer), representing a middle path or balance between spiritual extremes, ultimately leading to the experience of love.

A practical, five-step operative system for achieving 'perfect love.' It begins with man's initiatory prayer (movement 1), receives divine resonance (love from the Creator, movement 2), builds love 'in himself' through spiritual work (movement 3), enables the perception of love 'in the other' (movement 4), and culminates in an all-embracing return of love to the Creator (movement 5), unifying all existence.

A state of love experienced within oneself, achieved through diligent spiritual work and self-correction. This inner 'middle-line' is crucial; without it, one cannot correctly perceive or interact with the external world and its spiritual realities, nor can one truly see love 'in the other'.

The higher aspect of the human being, representing an innate 'dot of to give' or the desire to bestow. It is the locus from which prayer originates, serving as the starting point for transcending self-interest and initiating the spiritual ascent towards the Creator.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a structured, five-stage process (Formula of Love) for achieving 'perfect love' and alignment with the Creator, underpinned by the principle 'nothing comes from above if not aroused from below.' It necessitates moving beyond self-interest to absolute selflessness, a continuous process of self-correction. The system involves internal spiritual work ('three lines') to cultivate love within oneself before it can be truly perceived or expressed outwardly. It's a journey from human-initiated desire to divine reception and ultimate unification.
tools: Understanding of the 'three lines' (for spiritual balance)
rituals: Prayer (request for mercy, originating from the 'point in the heart')
Spiritual work on oneself (to build up love in oneself)
Act of seeing love 'in the other' (by recognizing Creator's attributes)
Drawing everything upon the Creator (culminating in all-embracing love)

relevant_quotes.text: The term 'hidden word' itself consists of two components: 'hidden' and `word'. What is 'word' in this context and what is 'hidden'? And why should the word 'hidden' be hidden? 'Word' in this context is the total of coverings in which the creative forces of the operational system of the universe are hidden after their `descending' in our world. It carries the message in it how man here on earth can and will come to the ultimate fulfillment and perfection.

If man regularly pursue this trait, both inwardly as outwardly, then the 'hidden' of the word will be increasingly dissolved for him, `the hidden word' is then increasingly 'revealed' for him.. In earthly life, this law is translated by the requirement from above that individual creations here on earth, should love each other unconditional.
The law of the earth is clear: maximize self-advantage with minimal effort. That is the eartly law of our life here on earth, and in itself it has no connection with the higher world.
But true love begins when I get the first signs whereby I see that I am at a big distance from the Creator. This is the beginning of true love.

One of the main principles of the system of the laws of the universe is: nothing comes from above if not aroused from below. So love can not come into you if you do not first ask for it! You must bring up prayer, and then from above comes light in the same degree that you have aroused the higher forces from below.
Love is in the Creator: He is in you, because within us radiates the light of the 'hidden word', the light of Infinity.
Everything outside your skin is the Only Creative Force, whose main attribute, absolute selflessness, is poured out among the whole universe.

You will see love in the other, and not cherish love for the other, because that is wishful thinking and the Creator absolutely doesn't want us to do so. If you claim to love others to cherish, then inevitably you deal with your own interest. If you see love in the other, then that means that in him you recognize the attributes of the Creator, even if it is a godless man, let alone that it is someone of good will, a person of another faith or another worldview â€” because everything outside yourself is the Creator!
Then you have reached the perfect love: the love that is not connected at the object of that love. You love the Creator and all creation unconditionally without any detours!
Love is To experience "the hidden word" as a result of the conformity qua attributes with the laws of the Universe.

critical_analysis.relevance: This paper is highly relevant to Western Esotericism, particularly Kabbalah, by articulating a universal spiritual system for love and connection to the Divine, transcending specific religious dogmas while drawing parallels between them. It provides a metaphysical framework that redefines 'love' from a conventional human emotion to a divine energetic state achieved through self-correction and adherence to cosmic law (absolute selflessness). The emphasis on 'three lines' and 'sefirot' directly links it to Qabalistic cosmology and practical spiritual paths, offering a coherent philosophical underpinning for magical and mystical work aimed at personal and universal transformation. Its reinterpretation of common terms like 'love' and 'self-love' within an esoteric context is crucial for practitioners seeking to understand the underlying mechanics of spiritual ascent and divine connection.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is primarily individuals engaged in advanced esoteric study and practice, particularly those interested in Kabbalah, Hermeticism, and comparative mysticism. The academic tone, use of specialized terminology ('hidden word,' 'three lines,' 'sefirot'), and philosophical depth suggest it is not for beginners. Practitioners seeking to deepen their understanding of divine love, self-transformation, and the universal principles governing spiritual evolution, as well as those looking for a theoretical framework to integrate diverse religious paths into a unified magical worldview, would find this analysis valuable. It implicitly addresses adepts who have already grasped fundamental concepts of spiritual work and are now seeking to apply them to the ultimate goal of unconditional love and unity with the Creator.
